trans-unit.source: Learn about to download assets to your computer.
trans-unit.target: Learn about to download assets to your computer.

trans-unit.source: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: How to: Deliver an Asset by Download
trans-unit.target: How to: Deliver an Asset by Download

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses options for delivering media assets uploaded to Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses options for delivering media assets uploaded to Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You can deliver Media Services content in numerous application scenarios.
trans-unit.target: You can deliver Media Services content in numerous application scenarios.

trans-unit.source: You can download media assets, or access them by using a locator.
trans-unit.target: You can download media assets, or access them by using a locator.

trans-unit.source: You can send media content to another application or to another content provider.
trans-unit.target: You can send media content to another application or to another content provider.

trans-unit.source: For improved performance and scalability, you can also deliver content by using a Content Delivery Network (CDN).
trans-unit.target: For improved performance and scalability, you can also deliver content by using a Content Delivery Network (CDN).

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to download media assets from Media Services to your local computer.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to download media assets from Media Services to your local computer.

trans-unit.source: The code queries the jobs associated with the Media Services account by job ID and accesses its **OutputMediaAssets** collection (which is the set of one or more output media assets that results from running a job).
trans-unit.target: The code queries the jobs associated with the Media Services account by job ID and accesses its **OutputMediaAssets** collection (which is the set of one or more output media assets that results from running a job).

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to download output media assets from a job, but you can apply the same approach to download other assets.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to download output media assets from a job, but you can apply the same approach to download other assets.
